predicate.note: Frames file for 'move' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus.

example.name: agentive
example.text: The leadership hopes *trace* to move the compromise measure promptly to the White House.

example.name: ergative
example.text: ...including about two million customers who *trace* have moved during that period.

example.name: with EXT
example.text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average moved 50 points.

example.name: measures as infinitive
example.text: Southeast Asian nations will move *trace* to accomodate Japanese business.

example.name: typical
example.text: This somewhat-ambiguous assessment moves one Alliance portfolio manager to ask: ``So, what is this -- a Stealth recession?''
example.arg: to ask: ``So, what is this -- a Stealth recession?''

example.name: charge!
example.text: The President of the United States urged the Panamanian armed forces [*-1] to move against Mr. Noriega.

example.name: similar, different prep
example.text: At the same time, abortion foes have developed a national legislative strategy, [*-3] deciding [*-4] to move on what Jacki Ragan, the National Right to Life Committee's director of state organizational development, calls `` reasonable measures that an overwhelming mainstream majority of Americans support.''
example.arg: what Jacki Ragan, the National Right to Life Committee's director of state organizational development, calls `` reasonable measures that an overwhelming mainstream majority of Americans support.''
